Document.Focus: Closed reduction of a fractured bone - aftercare

QAPair.Question: Do you have information about Closed reduction of a fractured bone - aftercare
QAPair.Answer: Closed reduction is a procedure to set (reduce) a broken bone without surgery. It allows the bone to grow back together with better alignment. It can be done by an orthopedic surgeon (bone doctor) or a primary care provider who has experience doing this procedure. After the procedure, your broken limb will be placed in a cast. Healing can take anywhere from 8 to 12 weeks. How quickly you heal will depend on: Your age, The size of the bone that broke, The type of break, Your general health ,
